This license applies to **personal, academic, and open-source usage**.

### Preamble

The GNU Affero General Public License is a free, copyleft license for software and other kinds of works, specifically designed to ensure cooperation with the community in the case of network server software.

The licenses for most software and other practical works are designed to take away your freedom to share and change the works. By contrast, our General Public Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to share and change all versions of a program--to make sure it remains free software for all its users.

When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not price. Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that you have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge for them if you wish), that you receive source code or can get it if you want it, that you can change the software or use pieces of it in new free programs, and that you know you can do these things.

Developers that use our General Public Licenses protect your rights with two steps: (1) assert copyright on the software, and (2) offer you this License which gives you legal permission to copy, distribute and/or modify the software.

A secondary benefit of defending all users' freedom is that improvements made in alternate versions of the program, if they receive widespread use, become available for other developers to incorporate. Many developers of free software are heartened and encouraged by the resulting cooperation. However, in the case of software used on network servers, this result may fail to come about. The GNU General Public License permits making a modified version and letting the public access it on a server without ever releasing its source code to the public.

The GNU Affero General Public License is designed specifically to ensure that, in such cases, the modified source code becomes available to the community. It requires the operator of a network server to provide the source code of the modified version running there to the users of that server. Therefore, public use of a modified version, on a publicly accessible server, gives the public access to the source code of the modified version.

For the complete AGPL-3.0 license text, see: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/agpl-3.0.en.html

## Option 2: Commercial License

For **proprietary or commercial use**, you must obtain a commercial license from Aletheion Research Collective.

### Commercial Use Includes:

- **Embedding in proprietary software** - Integrating AletheionGuard into closed-source applications
- **SaaS offerings** - Using AletheionGuard as part of a hosted service
- **Internal enterprise deployment** - Organizations with more than 100 users
- **Reselling or white-labeling** - Distributing AletheionGuard under your own brand
- **Any use where source code modifications are not disclosed** - If you modify AletheionGuard and don't want to release your changes under AGPL-3.0

### Why a Commercial License?

The AGPL-3.0 requires that if you modify AletheionGuard and use it to provide a network service, you must make your source code available to users. If your use case doesn't allow for this (e.g., proprietary software, internal tools), a commercial license provides:

- **No copyleft obligations** - Keep your modifications private
- **Priority support** - Direct access to the development team
- **Custom features** - Tailored implementations for your use case
- **Legal protection** - Indemnification and warranty coverage

### Pricing Tiers:

#### Startup License
- **$10,000/year**
- For companies with up to $1M annual revenue
- Includes:
  - Unlimited deployments
  - Email support
  - Quarterly updates

#### Growth License
- **$50,000/year**
- For companies with $1M-$10M annual revenue
- Includes:
  - Everything in Startup
  - Priority support (48-hour response)
  - Custom integration assistance
  - Monthly updates

#### Enterprise License
- **Custom pricing**
- For companies with >$10M annual revenue
- Includes:
  - Everything in Growth
  - Dedicated support engineer
  - Custom feature development
  - On-premise deployment options
  - Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
  - Legal indemnification

### How to Obtain a Commercial License

To purchase a commercial license or discuss custom terms:

- **Email**: contact@aletheionagi.com
- **Website**: https://aletheionguard.com/pricing
- **Phone**: Available upon request

Our team will work with you to understand your use case and provide the appropriate licensing structure.

## Choosing the Right License

| Use Case | License Required |
|----------|-----------------|
| Personal projects | AGPL-3.0 (Free) |
| Academic research | AGPL-3.0 (Free) |
| Open-source projects | AGPL-3.0 (Free) |
| Internal tools (< 100 users, source disclosed) | AGPL-3.0 (Free) |
| Proprietary software | Commercial |
| SaaS products | Commercial |
| Enterprise deployment (> 100 users) | Commercial |
| Reselling/white-labeling | Commercial |

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Q: Can I use AletheionGuard for free in my company?**
A: Yes, if you comply with AGPL-3.0 requirements (open-sourcing your modifications and disclosing source to network service users).

**Q: What if I only modify AletheionGuard internally?**
A: If you provide a network service using modified AletheionGuard (e.g., internal API), you must make the source available to users under AGPL-3.0. If this doesn't work for you, a commercial license is required.

**Q: Can I evaluate AletheionGuard before purchasing a commercial license?**
A: Yes, you can use the AGPL-3.0 version for evaluation. Contact us for extended trial terms if needed.

**Q: Do I need a commercial license for each deployment?**
A: No, our commercial licenses cover unlimited deployments within your organization.

**Q: Can I contribute back to the open-source version?**
A: Absolutely! We welcome contributions under the AGPL-3.0 license. See CONTRIBUTING.md for details.
